categories.name: Lost in Translation: Languages and Their Quirks

questions.clue: This language has the most native speakers in the world, over 900 million.
In this language, the word 'gift' means both 'present' and 'poison', leading to some amusing misunderstandings.
This language is known for its 14 different noun cases, making it notoriously complex.
In this language, the word 'kuchi zamishi' refers to eating when bored rather than hungry.
This African language is unique for its use of clicks as consonants, represented by symbols like 'ǃ' and 'ǀ'.

categories.name: From Page to Screen: Books That Became Movies

questions.clue: This J.K. Rowling book series about a young wizard became a blockbuster film franchise starting in 2001.
This 2008 movie about a teenage girl falling in love with a vampire is based on a Stephenie Meyer novel.
This 1961 film won Best Picture and is based on a novel by Harper Lee about racial injustice in the Deep South.
The 1995 film adaptation of this Jane Austen novel features Emma Thompson and Kate Winslet and explores themes of love and class.
Stanley Kubrick directed this 1971 film adaptation of an Anthony Burgess novel about a dystopian future and a delinquent named Alex.

categories.name: Historical Hiccups: Unexpected Events That Changed History

questions.clue: In 1066, an arrow to the eye changed the course of English history at this battle.
In 1588, the defeat of this fleet marked the decline of Spanish dominance and the rise of the British Empire.
In 1914, the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in this city led to the outbreak of World War I.
The 1815 eruption of Mount Tambora led to this 'year without a summer,' causing global crop failures and food shortages.
A storm in 1587 saved Japan from invasion by the Mongols, giving rise to this term meaning 'divine wind.'

categories.name: Art and Soul: Iconic Paintings and Their Stories

questions.clue: This painting by Leonardo da Vinci features a woman with an enigmatic smile and is housed in the Louvre.
Vincent van Gogh painted this swirling night scene in 1889 while staying at an asylum in Saint-Rémy-de-Provence.
This Spanish artist's 'Guernica' depicts the horrors of war following the bombing of a Basque town in 1937.
Painted by Grant Wood, this artwork features a farmer and his daughter standing before their house with a specific architectural style.
Edvard Munch's iconic painting, often seen as a symbol of existential angst, was inspired by a sunset walk in Oslo.

categories.name: Tech Talk: Breakthroughs That Shaped the Digital Age

questions.clue: In 1991, this global network system was made public, creating a digital revolution. It's what you're using to play this game.
The invention of this device in 1971 by Intel laid the groundwork for modern computing, fitting an entire CPU on a single chip.
This breakthrough in 1989 by Tim Berners-Lee allowed for the linking of information across different locations using hyperlinks.
Developed in 1997, this wireless communication technology allows devices to connect and exchange data over short distances.
In 2006, this company launched a cloud computing service called AWS, revolutionizing data storage and server management.

final.clue: This city, known for its iconic opera house, has the oldest continuously operating airport in the world, which began in 1920.
